cards.title: Flash forward / The rising stars of British photography
cards.rawTitle: The rising stars of British photography

item.title: Flash forward: the rising stars of British photography
item.trailText: From hunting meteorites to capturing India’s LGBT community, here is a selection of their best shots
item.standFirst: From hunting meteorites to capturing India’s LGBT community, FreshFaced + WildEyed at the Photographer’s Gallery brings together the work of 25 emerging photographers and artists from around the UK – here are some of their best shots

displayImages.caption:
Untitled, from the series Looking for Alice by Sian Davey
Davey’s photographs feature her three-year-old daughter Alice, who was born with Down’s Syndrome. The project reflects the family’s personal story while also examining attitudes in society towards young people with Down’s.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 1
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Untitled, from the series Looking for Alice by Sian Davey
Davey’s photographs feature her three-year-old daughter Alice, who was born with Down’s Syndrome. The project reflects the family’s personal story while also examining attitudes in society towards young people with Down’s.

displayImages.caption:
Girls! Girls! Girls! (2011-2015) by Francesca Jane Allen
This playful photographic series explores the transition between adolescence and womanhood, combining diary-like images with staged portraits touching on themes of friendship, love, sexuality and identity.
displayImages.credit: Francesca Jane Allen/Courtesy of the artist
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 2
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Girls! Girls! Girls! (2011-2015) by Francesca Jane Allen
This playful photographic series explores the transition between adolescence and womanhood, combining diary-like images with staged portraits touching on themes of friendship, love, sexuality and identity.

displayImages.caption:
Porters (2014), by Jill Quigley
Using splashes of paint, spray and bright props, Quigley stages colourful and playful interventions in abandoned Irish cottages, filling empty interiors with signs of movement and life.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 3
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Porters (2014), by Jill Quigley
Using splashes of paint, spray and bright props, Quigley stages colourful and playful interventions in abandoned Irish cottages, filling empty interiors with signs of movement and life.

displayImages.caption:
Red Nails (2014), by Rebecca Scheinberg
Rebecca Scheinberg uses the polished look of advertising and magazine photography to entice us with her images of perfect bodies. But the photos also suggest a darker story at work beneath the glossy sheen.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 4
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Red Nails (2014), by Rebecca Scheinberg
Rebecca Scheinberg uses the polished look of advertising and magazine photography to entice us with her images of perfect bodies. But the photos also suggest a darker story at work beneath the glossy sheen.

displayImages.caption:
I Am Fine (2014), by Jonathan Simpson
This video project investigates the dangerous and exploitative conditions of Singapore’s migrant workers, mainly Bangladeshi men who leave their families for several years at a time in order to support them. Simpson delivered video messages of love and support between the workers and their families, documenting the emotional impact of their separation.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 5
displayImages.cleanCaption:
I Am Fine (2014), by Jonathan Simpson
This video project investigates the dangerous and exploitative conditions of Singapore’s migrant workers, mainly Bangladeshi men who leave their families for several years at a time in order to support them. Simpson delivered video messages of love and support between the workers and their families, documenting the emotional impact of their separation.

displayImages.caption:
Blue Mountain, from the series The Meteorite Hunter (2014), by Alexandra Lethbridge
Lethbridge hunts for meteorites, exploring the places they come from and where they land, and documenting the artifacts she has accumulated in her search.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 6
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Blue Mountain, from the series The Meteorite Hunter (2014), by Alexandra Lethbridge
Lethbridge hunts for meteorites, exploring the places they come from and where they land, and documenting the artifacts she has accumulated in her search.

displayImages.caption:
San Diego, from American Series (2013-ongoing), by Emma Gruner
Referencing the aesthetics of mainstream pornography, Gruner’s images explore our modern fascination with self-representation and visual pleasure.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced + WildEyed 2015 7
displayImages.cleanCaption:
San Diego, from American Series (2013-ongoing), by Emma Gruner
Referencing the aesthetics of mainstream pornography, Gruner’s images explore our modern fascination with self-representation and visual pleasure.

displayImages.caption:
A Handful of Soil for the Whole Horizon #7 (2014), by Liz Orton
Combining scientific, poetic, performative and documentary elements – including material from survival manuals – Liz Orton depicts the human world destructively entangled with nature.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 8
displayImages.cleanCaption:
A Handful of Soil for the Whole Horizon #7 (2014), by Liz Orton
Combining scientific, poetic, performative and documentary elements – including material from survival manuals – Liz Orton depicts the human world destructively entangled with nature.

displayImages.caption:
Untitled #6, from Kothis, Hijras, Giriyas and Others (2013-14), by Charan Singh
Singh’s work is informed by 13 years of HIV/AIDS work and community activism in India. The Kothis (effeminate, underprivileged, homosexual men), Hijras (eunuchs), Giriyas (partners of Kothi and Hijra) are indigenous terms used by communities to define different sexual identities.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 9
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Untitled #6, from Kothis, Hijras, Giriyas and Others (2013-14), by Charan Singh
Singh’s work is informed by 13 years of HIV/AIDS work and community activism in India. The Kothis (effeminate, underprivileged, homosexual men), Hijras (eunuchs), Giriyas (partners of Kothi and Hijra) are indigenous terms used by communities to define different sexual identities.

displayImages.caption:
Roots (2014), by Mandukhai Kaylin
Through a combination of still and moving images, Mandukhai Kaylin’s work examines the blurred boundaries between the real and the artificial. Photograph: Mandukhai Kaylin/Courtesy of the artist
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 10
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Roots (2014), by Mandukhai Kaylin
Through a combination of still and moving images, Mandukhai Kaylin’s work examines the blurred boundaries between the real and the artificial.
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Mandukhai Kaylin/Courtesy of the artist

displayImages.caption:
X-Ray: Inside Venezuelan Public Hospitals (2014), by Betty Laura Zapata
Venezuela is experiencing one of the biggest economic and political crises in its history, and this undercover photographic project documents the state of public healthcare in the country. Only 16,000 hospital beds are used out of the 42,000 beds available, and patients that get a bed have little privacy.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 11
displayImages.cleanCaption:
X-Ray: Inside Venezuelan Public Hospitals (2014), by Betty Laura Zapata
Venezuela is experiencing one of the biggest economic and political crises in its history, and this undercover photographic project documents the state of public healthcare in the country. Only 16,000 hospital beds are used out of the 42,000 beds available, and patients that get a bed have little privacy.

displayImages.caption:
Beach Boys (2014) by James Bell
Beach Boys documents the bar owners, street vendors and hustlers of Dover Beach, Barbados, a popular and lucrative tourist location. The images capture the vulnerability of a community dependent on the tourist trade.
displayImages.altText: FreshFaced+WildEyed 2015 12
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Beach Boys (2014) by James Bell
Beach Boys documents the bar owners, street vendors and hustlers of Dover Beach, Barbados, a popular and lucrative tourist location. The images capture the vulnerability of a community dependent on the tourist trade.

cards.title: After the quake / Nepal reopens Unesco heritage sites

item.title: Nepal reopens Unesco heritage sites
item.trailText: Unesco world heritage sites including Kathmandu’s Durbar Square and the Boudhanath stupa were reopened on Monday by Nepalese authorities keen to bring back tourism following the devastating earthquake
item.standFirst: Unesco world heritage sites including Kathmandu’s Durbar Square and the Boudhanath stupa were reopened on Monday by Nepalese authorities keen to bring back tourism following the devastating earthquake

displayImages.caption:
Durbar Square, Kathmandu
 Nepalese masked dancers in traditional costumes perform in a ceremony in Durbar Square to mark the reopening of Kathmandu’s heritage sites Photograph: AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Nepalese masked dancers in traditional costumes perform in a ceremony in Durbar Square
displayImages.cleanCaption:

cards.title: On the Wall / Burns survivor walks the length of the Great Wall of China
cards.rawTitle: Burns survivor walks the length of the Great Wall of China

item.title: On the Wall: Turia Pitt's courage and the strength of the human spirit – short film
item.trailText: On the Wall is the remarkable story of Turia Pitt, who suffered burns to 65% of her body during Western Australia's 2011 ultramarathon
item.standFirst: In 2011 Turia Pitt was burnt in a bushfire during an ultramarathon and suffered burns to 65% of her body. Many thought she wouldn't survive. Now, after years of recovery, Turia is walking the Great Wall of China to raise money for the medical organisation Interplast. In this short film, Turia shows just what the human spirit is capable of with courage, strength and an incredible sense of humour. Shot and directed by Dave Zwolenski of Real Good Kid Productions, On the Wall was a finalist in the Australian shorts category at the Human Rights Arts and Film festival

stillImage.caption: Turia Pitt, featured in the mini documentary On The Wall Photograph: Real Good Kid Productions Photograph: Real Good Kid Productions
stillImage.cleanCaption: Turia Pitt, featured in the mini documentary On The Wall Photograph: Real Good Kid Productions

image.altText: Turia Pitt On The Wall
image.cleanCaption: Turia Pitt, featured in the mini documentary On The Wall Photograph: Real Good Kid Productions

cards.title: Climate change / Seattle 'kayaktivists' protest Shell drilling rig as it heads to Arctic
cards.rawTitle: Seattle 'kayaktivists' protest Shell drilling rig as it heads to Arctic

item.title: Seattle 'kayaktivists' protest Shell drilling rig as it leaves for the Arctic
item.trailText: Hundreds of activists in kayaks and small boats fanned out on a Seattle bay on Saturday to protest plans by Royal Dutch Shell to resume oil exploration in the Arctic
item.standFirst: Hundreds of activists in kayaks and small boats fanned out on a Seattle bay on Saturday to protest plans by Royal Dutch Shell to resume oil exploration in the Arctic and to keep two of its drilling rigs stored in the city's port. Several were detained on Monday for violating the safety zone around the vessel carrying the rig, police say

stillImage.caption: Activists protest the Shell Oil Company's drilling rig Polar Pioneer which is parked at Terminal 5 at the Port of Seattle, Washington May 16, 2015. Hundreds of activists in kayaks and small boats fanned out on a Seattle bay on Saturday to protest plans by Royal Dutch Shell to resume oil exploration in the Arctic and keep two of its drilling rigs stored in the city's port.      REUTERS/Jason Redmond      TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY Photograph: Jason Redmond/Reuters Photograph: Jason Redmond/Reuters
stillImage.altText: Activists protest the Shell Oil Company's drilling rig Polar Pioneer in Seattle, Washington

cards.title: Georgia / Floods in Tbilisi and its zoo
cards.rawTitle: Floods in Tbilisi and its zoo

item.title: Floods in Tbilisi and its zoo
item.trailText: At least 13 people have died due to severe flooding in the capital of Georgia, and 11 people are still missing. Animals escaped from the zoo and roamed the streets of Tbilisi, and police shot many due to safety concerns
item.standFirst:
At least 13 people have died due to severe flooding in the capital of Georgia, and 11 people are still missing. Animals escaped from the zoo and roamed the streets of Tbilisi, and police shot many due to safety concerns.

Georgia police accused of unnecessarily shooting zoo animals after floods

displayImages.caption: People stand by the destroyed embankment of the Vere river after Sunday’s flooding. Photograph: Pavel Golovkin/AP
displayImages.altText: People stand by the destroyed embankment of the Vere river after Sunday’s flooding.
displayImages.cleanCaption: People stand by the destroyed embankment of the Vere river after Sunday’s flooding.

cards.title: Unleash the dogs / The Whippet Derby

item.title: The Whippet Derby
item.trailText: The Classic English Whippet Derby 2015 meeting at Fordingbridge recreation ground. The event attracted 106 entries for the various competitions held over two days
item.standFirst: The Classic English Whippet Derby 2015 meeting at Fordingbridge recreation ground. The event attracted 106 entries for the various competitions held over two days

cards.title: Look, no glove / Baseball fan makes amazing catch

item.title: Baseball fan makes amazing catch
item.trailText: A GoPro video captures the moment a fan caught a baseball barehanded after a game in the city of Biloxi in Mississippi
item.standFirst: A GoPro video captures the moment a fan caught a baseball barehanded after a game in the city of Biloxi in Mississippi on 6 June. In the video, a member of the crowd, Micah Graves, was seen lifting his arm up to catch a baseball pitched by a player on the ground after the end of the game. The video was posted to social media on 7 June and has had at least 1.6m views online
